title: donwload non riuscito
content: A seguito di un aggiornamento, ormai da qualche mese, non si riesce piu a scaricare file nella sezione download compare il messaggio "download non riuscito" quasi su tutti i file di qualsiasi estensione, avvolte anche con file con estensione .PDF Ho provaro più volta a ripristinare, avviarlo senza estensioni, disinstarlarlo e reinstarlarlo senza esito positivo. A che serve tenere Firefox quando devo usare altro browser per poter scaricare file o allegati di posta? Se riuscite a darmi una dritta per risolvere il problema sarò felice di continuare ad utilizzare Firefox.
creator: gianrico.moretti

title: Ripristino ultime finestre chiuse dopo due settimane di inattività
content: Buongiorno. Ho un problema che non riesco a risolvere: lavoro correntemente con tre finestre aperte, ognuna con X schede. Solitamente avvio FireFox e in tal modo si apre la finestra "principale" quindi dal menu Cronologia - Finestre chiuse di recente apro le altre due finestre. Oggi, di ritorno dalle ferie (2 settimane), il menu Finestre chiuse di recente è disattivo e mi è quindi impossibile aprire le altre due finestre se non cercando nella cronologia (ma una delle due finestre aveva davvero molte schede aperte quindi l'impresa è ardua). Ho letto delle risposte di circa un anno fa in cui si indicava di utilizzare il menu Rispristina sessione precedente ma nel mio menu Cronologia questa voce non è presente. Esiste una soluzione, eventualmente anche andando a copiare/spostare/modificare dei files ? Premetto che ho navigato con FireFox ma ho salvato alcuni files che pare contengano i dati per riaprire le finestre. Grazie Marco Melecchi
creator: MMelecchi68

title: Access Denied Error 21 message
content:
I have a subscription to ancestry.com. However, I've noticed several Firefox updates ago that I can no longer write a story and add it to an ancestor's media gallery. When I do, I keep getting this:

Access Denied Error 21

What happened? This request was blocked by security rules.

Your IP: (gives my IP addy) Incident ID: (gives a different incident ID each time I try it and get the error message).


WHAT IS this? And how can I resolve it? I have completely deleted my browser history, cookies, cache, everything and it doesn't make a difference. I'm still getting this message but ONLY in Firefox. Not in other browsers. I use Firefox to do most of my genealogical research, but this may have to change if I can't get it to work with ancestry.com. I've also alerted them to the problem, but so far they haven't come up with a solution, other than to delete cookies/cache/history, which I have done. It can't be my computer or it would do it on all three browsers I have installed - Microsoft Edge, Google Chrome, and Mozilla Firefox. But it doesn't. Only in Firefox. It has to be something in the browser settings. Anyone have a clue?
creator: kentuckywoman2

Is there bare way I can fix this problem through my Firefox Account
creator: jrober42

title: Abnormal window size behavior
content:
For no reason I can name, Firefox's window sizing has gone bonkers.

I'm using Firefox 101.0.1 with Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise. I have two Firefox windows open.

When I unlock the computer after a period of non-use, the Firefox task bar icon has two white bars at the edge, indicating that two windows are open, but the windows not visible. Quitting and restarting Firefox does not help.

To recover the first window I must float the mouse over the task bar icon, opening thumbnails of the windows, then right click the first thumbnail and select Maximize. This makes the maximized window appear. Then I can drag the window away from the edge of the screen, reducing its size. After that it behaves normally until the computer is locked and unlocked; then the process repeats.

I can't recover the second window at all. Its thumbnail is empty except for a tiny rectangle in the upper left corner, presumably representing a tiny window. When I right click the thumbnail it doesn't open a menu; it just displays a blue rectangle as high as a normal window's title bar and about four times wider than high. Presumably this is what's left of the window. It has no title, no minimize/maximize/close buttons, and no system menu icon. Trying to change its size by dragging its edges has no effect. Nor does trying to maximize it by pushing it up to the top edge of the desktop.

What can I do to make Firefox behave normally? How can I prevent this from happening again?
creator: Jonathan.H

title: Bookmark Favicons
content: Favicons do not seem to be saving with the bookmarks on many manga sites that I read. Examples https://manhuaplus.com/manga/emperors-domination/ https://mangaweebs.in/manga/pqmiwcdmho/ https://novelmic.com/manga/god-of-martial-arts-comics/ https://www.nightcomic.com/manga/spare-me-great-lord/ There are many more these are just a few. Also sometimes they do save correctly, be it after only clicking it one time to load it or twenty times. They do randomly work sometimes. This has nothing to does with all the normal ways of trying to fix favicons not saving or updating. I have tried all the ways I could find by googling. Most of the bookmarks save just fine. Its only the ones that come from many of the manga sites I read so it has to do with their sites I believe. I do not think their sites aren't broken for saving the favicons though because they do work random and if I try to save any of the websites as bookmarks in chrome it works perfectly. I hope this is just a small fix you can implement or tell me more of a direct way of fixing it myself because I can not find a solution that will work consistently. Especially after clearing history, cookies, and cache.
creator: drsand40

title: Get rid of address bar search
content:
I like to set my home page to my search engine, and I want to type on the page in the nice long search field there, not on the d---d address bar! The following preferences have all been offered as fixes to eliminate searching in the address bar, but none of them are currently working for me in FF 102.0.1:

Do about:config; search for the browser.urlbar.suggest.searches preference setting it to false.

Also browser.fixup.alternate.enabled needs to be set to false Also browser.urlbar.oneOffSearches = false

Also to disable searching when typing an address (e.g. the URI fails to resolve and it tries to use a search engine) turn keyword.enabled to false.

What does work?
creator: schmibble
